an10.79:4.1: “Mendicants, there are ten grounds for resentment.
an10.79:4.3: Thinking: ‘They did wrong by me,’ you harbor resentment.
an10.79:4.4: Thinking: ‘They are doing wrong by me’ …
an10.79:4.6: ‘They did wrong by someone I love’ …
an10.79:4.7: ‘They are doing wrong by someone I love’ …
an10.79:4.8: ‘They will do wrong by someone I love’ … ‘They helped someone I dislike’ …
an10.79:4.9: They are helping someone I dislike’ …
an10.79:4.10: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike,’ you harbor resentment.
an10.79:4.11: You get angry for no reason.
an10.79:4.12: These are the ten grounds for resentment.”
